SEARCH
Package io.github.jy95.fds.common.functions

Interface RangeToString<R,Q extends org.hl7.fhir.instance.model.api.IBase,C extends FDSConfig & QuantityProcessor<Q>>

Type Parameters:
R - The type of range object to be converted.
Q - The type of quantity object to be converted.
C - The type of configuration object extending FDSConfig.
All Known Implementing Classes:
RangeToStringR4, RangeToStringR5
public interface RangeToString<R,Q extends org.hl7.fhir.instance.model.api.IBase,C extends FDSConfig & QuantityProcessor<Q>>
Interface for converting range objects to human-readable strings.
Since:
1.0.0
Author:
jy95

  • Method Details

    • convert

      default CompletableFuture<String> convert(TranslationService<C> translationService, R range)
      Converts a range object to a human-readable string asynchronously.
      Parameters:
      translationService - The service providing localized strings and configuration context.
      range - The range object to convert.
      Returns:
      A CompletableFuture that resolves to the human-readable string.

    • getQuantityToString

      QuantityToString<Q,C> getQuantityToString()
      Retrieves the utility class for processing Quantity within the range object
      Returns:
      a QuantityToString bound to the FHIR version

    • getHigh

      Q getHigh(R range)
      Retrieve the high Quantity
      Parameters:
      range - The range object.
      Returns:
      The "high" quantity of the range

      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • hasUnit

      default boolean hasUnit(R range)
      Determines if a range has a unit (either code or text).
      Parameters:
      range - The range object.
      Returns:
      True if the range has a unit, false otherwise.

    • getBaseArguments

      default Map<String,Object> getBaseArguments(R range, String unitAsText)
      Compute the base arguments required for formatting the range object.
      Parameters:
      range - The range object.
      unitAsText - The unit, if present
      Returns:
      A Map containing "minValue", "maxValue", and "condition" at least

    • convertWithoutUnit

      default CompletableFuture<String> convertWithoutUnit(TranslationService<C> translationService, R range)
      Convert a range without a unit to a human-readable string.

      range - The range object.
      Returns:
